meanings.sent1: The beaver tried to outgnaw the squirrel on the fallen tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The hungry dog managed to outgnaw the bone faster than the other dogs.
meanings.sent3: The race was on to see which rodent could outgnaw the wooden block first.
meanings.sent4: The termite seemed to outgnaw the wood effortlessly, leaving a trail of destruction behind.
meanings.sent5: The determined rabbit set out to outgnaw the wire fence to reach the juicy carrots on the other side.

meanings.definition: To chew or wear away more than another
meanings.sent1: The little mouse tried to outgnaw the tough piece of cheese.
meanings.sent2: The enthusiastic puppy would always outgnaw his toys in record time.
meanings.sent3: The beaver decided to outgnaw the wooden stick instead of building a dam with it.
meanings.sent4: The relentless waves seemed to outgnaw the sandy shore with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The determined squirrel would outgnaw the acorns before storing them for winter.

meanings.definition: To gnaw more effectively than another
meanings.sent1: The industrious ants would outgnaw the fallen leaves to build their nest.
meanings.sent2: The old beaver could still outgnaw the young ones with its sharp teeth.
meanings.sent3: The competition was fierce as each rodent tried to outgnaw the wooden block.
meanings.sent4: The determined caterpillar seemed to outgnaw the leaf faster than its siblings.
meanings.sent5: The diligent squirrel would outgnaw the nutshells with precision and speed.
